title: Bringing Jack's Law To The UK | 10 News+
description: Gold Coast father Brett Beasley was on a flight to the United Kingdom when a mass stabbing unfolded on a train from Doncaster to London.  He is advocating for Jack's Law, which gives police wide-ranging powers to search for knives in public places, to be passed in the UK.  The legislation, which is in effect in Queensland, New South Wales, and the Northern Territory, is named after Brett's son Jack, who was stabbed to death in 2019. title: Alleged Kidnappers Arrested & Charged After Sydney Man Was Found Detained & Attacked | 10 News
description: The sister of the man dubbed the Balenciaga bikie has been accused of a kidnapping plot. Along with another man, the woman is accused of holding and beating her alleged victim at her apartment, where she was seen attacking the alleged victim when police arrived. title: Optus CEO Grilled Over Deadly Triple-Zero Outage | 10 News
description: The troubled telco giant Optus has been hammered at a parliamentary inquiry over its Triple-Zero phone call failure that has been linked to three deaths. Among the revelations, Optus staff held 11 meetings, including crisis talks to work out talking points, before they revealed the failure to the public. title: Australian Taxation Office Fights To Stop Working From Home Expense Claims | 10 News
description: The Australian Taxation Office is fighting to overturn a ruling that could mean renters can claim thousands of dollars in tax deductions for working from home expenses. The case upheld a radio presenter’s claim for costs related to converting a second bedroom into a home office at the height of the pandemic. title: Melbourne Hit With Wild Wet Weather, Triggering Flash Floods | 10 News
description: Melbourne has been drenched in a 24-hour downpour, causing flash flooding in parts of the CBD. The rain is kicking off a wet week for the state, with the weather bureau warning tomorrow’s racegoers to ditch the heels for gumboots. title: UK Train Stabbing Suspect In Custody, Jetstar Flight Chaos, Liberals' Net Zero Divide | 10 News+
description: A Jetstar flight has been cancelled four times in four days, leaving passengers stranded and frustrated. JQ-7 from Melbourne to Singapore may be Australia’s unluckiest flight, and some travellers say the change wasn’t even communicated.   The Coalition is on the precipice once again, with the Nationals dumping their support for reducing emissions to net zero by 2050. The Liberal Party itself is also split, with the right faction wanting to follow the Nationals. It comes as voters’ support for the Coalition has reached a record low, with Newspoll results showing only a 24% approval rating.    Chinese manufacturer BYD is stockpiling vehicles in the suburbs, with a waterpark south of Sydney packed full with brand new electric cars. The company has imported 51,000 cars in the year to September, but only sold around 38,000 units. Experts believe it is related to a government loophole that is allowing BYD to accumulate carbon credits. title: Mushroom Killer Erin Patterson’s Appeal, Storms Smash Australians, $1500 Coffee | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – triple-murderer Erin Patterson has officially filed an appeal of her convictions, wild weather has battered Australia’s east coast as Sydney gets hits with hail and heavy rains, Optus slammed after it was revealed they waited hours to tell the public and government about a deadly outage, Trump heads to the supreme court over his sweeping tariffs, and why some people are paying $1500 for a cup of coffee. title: Mushroom Cook Erin Patterson Lodges Appeal Of Triple Murder Convictions | 10 News
description: Convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson has officially lodged an appeal, fighting the finding that she killer her parents-in-law Don and Gail Patterson and Gail’s sister Heather Wilkinson, with a beef wellington in 2023.
